Module com.github.sttk.cliargs
Package com.github.sttk.cliargs

Class CliArgs

java.lang.Object
com.github.sttk.cliargs.CliArgs
public class CliArgs extends Object
Provides the static methods to parse and print command line arguments.

    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static final record 
    CliArgs.ConfigHasDefaultsButHasNoArg
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an opiton configuration contradicts that the option has default value(s) (.defaults != null) though it has no option argument (.hasArg == false).
    static final record 
    CliArgs.ConfigIsArrayButHasNoArg
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option configuration contradicts that the option is an array (.isArray == true) though it has no option argument (.hasArg == false).
    static final record 
    CliArgs.ConfigIsNotArrayButDefaultsIsArray
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option configuration contradicts that the option is not an array (.isArray == false) but default value (.defaults is an array.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.FailToConvertDefaultsInOptAnnotation
    Is the exception reason which indicates that default value(s) defined in Opt annotation is failed to convert to the specified type value.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.FailToConvertOptionArg
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option argument is failed to convert the specified type value.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.FailToSetOptionStoreField
    Is the exception reason which indicates that it is failed to set option arguments (including those from default values) to a field of an option store.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.IllegalOptionType
    Is the exception reason which indicates that a type of a field of the option store is neither a boolean, a number, a string, or an array of numbers or strings.
    static interface 
    CliArgs.InvalidOption
    Is implemented by records that indicate exception reasons, and provides a method to retrieve an option name.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.OptionHasInvalidChar
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an invalid character is found in an option.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.OptionIsNotArray
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option is input with an option argument multiple times though its option configuration specifies the option is not an array (.isArray == false).
    static final record 
    CliArgs.OptionNameIsDuplicated
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option name in .names field is duplicated another among all option configurations.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.OptionNeedsArg
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option is input with no option argument though its option configuration requires option argument (.hasArg == true).
    static final record 
    CliArgs.OptionTakesNoArg
    Is the exception reason which indicates that an option is input with an option argument though its option configuration does not accept option arguments (.hasArg == false).
    static final record 
    CliArgs.StoreKeyIsDuplicated
    Is the exception reason which indicates that a store key in an option configuration is duplicated another among all option configurations.
    static final record 
    CliArgs.UnconfiguredOption
    Is the exception reason which indicates that there is no configuration about the input option.

  • Constructor Details

      Parameters:

      args - Command line arguments.

  • Method Details

    • parse

      public Result parse()
      Parses command line arguments without option configurations.

      This method divides command line arguments to command arguments, which are not associated with any options, and options, of which each has a name and option arguments. If an option appears multiple times in command line arguments, the option has multiple option arguments. Options are divided to long format options and short format options.

      A long format option starts which "--" and follows multiple characters which consists of alphabets, numbers, and '-'. (A character immediately after the heading "--" allows only an alphabets.)

      A short format option starts with "-" and follows single character which is an alphabet. Multiple short options can be combined into one argument. (For example -a -b -c can be combined into -abc.) Moreover, a short option can be followed by "=" and its option argument. In case of combined short options, only the last short option can take an option argument. (For example, -abc=3 is equal to -a -b -c=3.)

      Returns:
      A Result object that contains the parsed result.

    • parseWith

      public Result parseWith(OptCfg[] optCfgs)
      Parses command line arguments with option configurations.

      This method divides command line arguments to command arguments and options. And an option consists of a name and an option argument. Options are divided to long format options and short format options. About long/short format options, since they are same with parse() method, see the comment of that method.

      This method basically allows only options declared in option configurations. When an option in command line arguments matches one of the names in an option configuration, the option is registered into Cmd with storeKey. If both hasArg and isArray are true, the option can have one or multiple option arguments, and if hasArg is true and isArray is false, the option can have only one option argument, otherwise the option cannot have option arguments. If defaults is specified and no option argument is give in command line arguments, the option argument(s) is set to the value(s) of defaults. If converter is specified and option argument(s) is given in command line arguments, the value or each of option argument(s) are converted with the converter. If type is specified but converter is not specified, a converter which converts a string to the specified type value is set. If postparser is specified, it processes option arguments (including those set from default values) after parsing.

      If options not declared in option configurations are given in command line arguments, this method basically throws a ReasonedException with the reason UnconfiguredOption. However, if you want to allow other options, add an option configuration of which storeKey or the first element of names is "*".

      Parameters:
      optCfgs - An array of OptCfg objects.
      Returns:
      A Result object that contains the parsed result.

    • parseFor

      public Result parseFor(Object options)
      Parses command line arguments and sets their values to the option store which is the second argument of this method. This method divides command line arguments to command arguments and options, then sets the options to the option store, and returns the command arguments with the generated option configurations.

      The configurations of options are determined by types and annotations of fields of the option store. If the type is a boolean, the option takes no argument. If the type is a number or a string, the option can takes single option argument, therefore it can appear once in command line arguments. If the type is an array, the option can takes multiple option arguments, therefore it can appear multiple times in command line arguments.

      The annotation type is @Opt and it can have annotation elements: cfg, desc, and arg. The cfg element can be specified names and default values(s) of an option. It has a special format like cfg="foo-bar,f=123". The first part of the element value is option names, which are separated by commas, and ends with "=" mark or end of string. If the option name is empty or no cfg element value, the option's name becomes same with the field name of the option store.

      The string after the "=" mark is default value(s). If the type of the option is a boolean, the string after "=" mark is ignored because a boolean option takes no option argument. If the type of the option is a number or a string, the whole string after "=" mark is default value(s). If the type of the option is an array, the string after "=" mark have to be rounded by square brackets and separate the elements with commas, like [elem1,elem2,elem3]. The element separator can be used other than a comma by putting the separator chracter before the open square bracket, like :[elem1:elem2:elem3]. It's useful when some array elements include commas.

      NOTE: A default value of an empty array in cfg annotation element is [], like cfg="name=[]", it doesn't represent an array which contains only one empty string. If you want to specify an array which contains only one empty string, write nothing after "=" mark, like cfg="name=".

      Parameters:
      options - An option store object.
      Returns:
      A Result object that contains the parsed result.

    • makeOptCfgsFor

      public static OptCfg[] makeOptCfgsFor(Object options) throws com.github.sttk.exception.ReasonedException
      Makes an OptCfg array from the fields of the option store with the annnotation @Opt.

      About the process for OptCfg using Opt annotation, see the comment of parseFor(java.lang.Object) method.

      Parameters:
      options - An option store object.
      Returns:
      An OptCfg array.
      Throws:
      com.github.sttk.exception.ReasonedException - If it is failed to create OptCfg objects from the fields of the option store object.

    • findFirstArg

      public static int findFirstArg(String... args)
      Finds the index of the first non option-format element in a specified string array. If non option-format element is not found, this method return a negative integer. If "--" is found before finding non option-format element, the next index is always returned if its element starts with hyphens.
      Parameters:
      args - A string array from command line arguments.
      Returns:
      The index of the first non option element.
